SpatialDryArtifacts 0.0.0.9000
  • Reference

Classify edge dryspots into categories for quality control (Enhanced Version)

Source: R/detectEdgeDryspots.R
classifyEdgeDryspots.Rd

This function classifies detected edge dryspots and problem areas into different categories based on size and quality metrics for downstream filtering decisions. Enhanced with backward compatibility.

classifyEdgeDryspots(
  spe,
  samples = "sample_id",
  min_spots = 20,
  low_umi_threshold = 100,
  removal_threshold = 0.5,
  name = "edge_dryspot",
  exclude_slides = NULL
)

Arguments

spe

A SpatialExperiment object that has been processed with detectEdgeDryspots()

samples

Character string specifying the sample ID column name (default: "sample_id")

min_spots

Minimum number of spots required for a problem area to be considered (default: 20)

low_umi_threshold

UMI count threshold below which spots are considered low quality (default: 100)

removal_threshold

Proportion threshold for marking problem areas for removal (default: 0.5)

name

Character string matching the name used in detectEdgeDryspots() (default: "edge_dryspot")

exclude_slides

Character vector of slide IDs to exclude from edge detection (default: NULL)

Value

A SpatialExperiment object with additional classification columns in colData:

name_true_edges

Logical indicating edges after slide exclusion

name_binary

Character classification: "edge", "problem area", or "none"

name_classification

Character detailed classification: "edge", "remove", "flag", "small", or "none"

name_enhanced

Character enhanced classification: "edge_dryspot", "interior_outlier", etc.

name_edge_zone

Numeric/Character indicating edge zone: 1, 2, 3, or "interior"

name_sample_type

Character sample type: "corner", "edge", or "interior"

Examples

# Basic usage (after running detectEdgeDryspots)
if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{
spe <- classifyEdgeDryspots(spe)

# View enhanced classifications
table(spe$edge_dryspot_enhanced)
table(spe$edge_dryspot_edge_zone)
} # }
